TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MimeContentBinding extends System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension

Docs.summary: Represents an extensibility element added to an or an within an XML Web service, specifying the MIME format for the body of the HTTP transmission. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about specifying protocols for XML Web services, see [[\<topic://cpconbuildingaspnetwebservices>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01dfc27c-c68e-4910-a0aa-5e4c2a766b0c). For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the properties and methods exposed by the `MimeContentBinding` class.
[!code-cpp[MimeContentBinding_Part_4#4](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.web.services.de_45_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[MimeContentBinding_Part_4#4](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.web.services.de_45_1.cs)] [!code-vb[MimeContentBinding_Part_4#4](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.web.services.de_45_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Specifies the URI for the XML namespace of the class. This field is constant.
Gets or sets the name of the to which the applies.
Docs.value: A string representing the name of the with which the current is associated. The default value is an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the format of the body of the HTTP transmission.
Docs.value: A string indicating the format of the body of the HTTP transmission. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Web Services Description Language (WSDL) specification defines bindings for several MIME types, including text/xml, multipart/related, and application/x-www-form-urlencoded, although any MIME type can be used. The wildcard character (*) can also be used. For example, the string "text/\*" would represent all text types. If the value of this property is not set, the `MimeContentBinding` specifies all MIME types.
For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples MimeContentBinding_Part_4#1
